title: Paris knifeman who killed four colleagues linked to Islamic extremist group
text:
Knifeman Michael Harpon has been linked to a radical Islamist terrorist group (Picture: Getty/Reuters)

A man who killed four colleagues at the police headquarters in Paris has been linked to a radical Islamist terrorist group.

Muslim convert Michael Harpon, 45, stabbed a senior officer and three guardians of the peace to death during his rampage at the Paris Police Prefecture, which is located next to Notre Dame Cathedral.

The deaf IT worker, who was eventually shot dead by police officers yesterday afternoon, was found to have contact with a ‘radical Islamist group’ such as ISIS of Al-Qaeda, according to a source close to the case.

Police made the discovery after arresting his wife, Iham, who is also deaf, and then raiding his home in Paris suburb Gonesse where they found the links on a computer and phone records.

Anti-terrorist prosecutors have opened an enquiry for ‘assassination of a public servant in relation to a terrorist enterprise, attempted assassination of a public servant in relation to a terrorist enterprise, and conspiracy in terrorism’.

Security personnel is seen after an attack on the police headquarters in Paris, France (Picture: Reuters)

The nature of the attack by Harpon, who originally came from the French overseas territory of Martinique, corresponded with similar ones carried out by terrorists affiliated to ISIS and Al-Qaeda.

The source said: ‘Many of those involved in similar attacks on the police have been Muslim converts influenced by radical terrorist groups.’

Mrs Harpon is still being held by police and is believed to have offered evidence against her deceased husband.

Communication with her is said to be ‘very complicated’ as it is being made through sign language but she did tell officers her husband had ‘heard voices’ and was ‘incoherent and suffered a dementia attack’ the night before.

The couple have two children aged nine and three.

Harpon had converted to Islam 18 months ago, and his wife is also a Muslim.

Colleagues had described Harpon as a previously trusted employee who had full security clearance to work in the Prefecture’s IT department.

He managed to evade metal detectors by carrying a ceramic knife.

The deceased were identified as General Damien E., 50, Brice L., 38, Anthony L.., also 38, and Aurelia T., 39.

It was the worst loss of French police lives in a single day since World War II.

President Emmanuel Macron visited the Paris Police Prefecture building in person, along with his Prime Minister, Edouard Philippe, and Interior Minister Christophe Castaner.

Additional reporting by Peter Allen.
description: A man who killed four colleagues at a police station in Paris has been linked to a radical Islamist terrorist group.
